intro: Dehaasia bandaharensis, commonly known as the Bandaharensis plant, is a rare flowering species native to the tropical regions of southern India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in dense forest undergrowth. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
